alert.note: Alert for Covington; Crenshaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 3:55AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CRENSHAW AND NORTHERN COVINGTON COUNTIES THROUGH 445 AM CST... At 354 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near River Falls, or 7 miles northwest of Andalusia, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Andalusia, River Falls, Red Level, Dozier, Heath, and Gantt. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CST for south central Alabama.
